oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Interviews the Oak Ridge Boys - Outtakes
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is of the outtakes recorded from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of the Oak Ridge Boys (performance group) for Nashville's WSM. Recording is from an unknown date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Oak Ridge Boys
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Ralph Emery, Joe Bonsall, Richard Sterban, and Duane Allen discuss the layout of the areas surrounding Nashville -- (02:37) Sterban reveals the amount of people that come to visit can be found out through Conway Twitty -- (03:14) The Oak Ridge Boys discuss how ""Never Hurts to Hurt"" was recorded because of Ron Page -- (04:10) Bonsall discusses Sylvester Stallone's role in Rhinestone and all of them joke about Bonsall's review; the Oak Ridge Boys joke aboutJerry Clowers's clothing selections -- (10:05) Bonsall discusses being a member of the Southernaires -- (11:28) The Oak Ridge Boys reflect on the first time they saw one of their songs on the jukebox; additionally, the Oak Ridge Boys and Emery introduce a Barbara Mandrell track
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Oak Ridge Boys;
